Okay. I can help you with that. xur1z: http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/karmic/main/installer-i386/current/images/netboot/
Download boot.img.gz
Open a terminal. There are a certain path that need to be chmod first but I can't remember where so we'll go in root for hassle-free. "sudo -i"
Plug in the USB.  We do "fdisk -l" to find the path of usb device. (/dev/sdX)
When we find the USB dev, we do "umount /dev/sdX" -- Then we do "zcat /home/xurl/Desktop/boot.img.gz > /dev/sdX"
When you get the prompt, wait few seconds to ensure it is finished writing everything.  Now, unplug and try it on the netbook (with Internet).
It's only 15MB file.
11.7MB to be precise. :)
For installation. Yes. Give the netbook a wired connection. So it can download latest packages from the mirrors.
Please use my nickname.  You don't get highlighted messages out of magic. :0
I gave you the complete instruction. No need for mini.iso.  boot.img.gz is all you need.
No problem. You're welcome to run things by me to ensure you're doing it correctly.
